transferfunclist¶

Functions and classes for processing lists of transfer functions.

Table of Classes

TransferFuncList(tflist) List of transfer functions.
TransferFuncInterp(tflistarrs[, rs_nodes, …]) Interpolation function over list of TransferFuncList objects.

Classes¶

class darkhistory.spec.transferfunclist.TransferFuncList(tflist)¶

Bases: object

List of transfer functions.

Parameters:tflist (list of TransFuncAtRedshift or TransFuncAtEnergy) –
tflist¶

List of transfer functions that is part of this class.

Type:list of TransFuncAtRedshift or TransFuncAtEnergy
tftype¶

Type of transfer functions in the list: ‘rs’ for TransFuncAtRedshift, ‘in_eng’ for TransFuncAtEnergy

Type:{‘rs’, ‘in_eng’}
rs¶

Redshift abscissa of the transfer functions.

Type:ndarray
in_eng¶

Injection energy abscissa of the transfer functions.

Type:ndarray
spec_type¶

The type of spectra stored in the transfer functions.

Type:{‘N’, ‘dNdE’}
dlnz¶

The d ln(1+z) step for the transfer functions.

Type:float

Table of Methods

at_val(axis, new_val[, bounds_error, fill_value]) Returns the transfer functions at the new abscissa.
coarsen(dlnz_factor[, delete_tfs, …]) Coarsens the new transfer function with larger dlnz.
transpose() Transposes the list of transfer functions.
at_val(axis, new_val, bounds_error=None, fill_value=nan)¶

Returns the transfer functions at the new abscissa.

Parameters:
  • axis ({'rs', 'in_eng', '2D_in_eng'}) – The axis along which to perform the interpolation. If the axis is ‘rs’, then the list will be transposed into tftype ‘in_eng’ and vice-versa.
  • new_val (ndarray or tuple of ndarrays (in_eng, eng)) – The new redshift or injection energy abscissa.
  • bounds_error (bool, optional) – See scipy.interpolate.interp1d
  • fill_value (array-like or (array-like, array-like) or "extrapolate", optional) – See scipy.interpolate.interp1d
coarsen(dlnz_factor, delete_tfs=True, coarsen_type='prop', prop_transfunclist=None)¶

Coarsens the new transfer function with larger dlnz.

This is obtained by multiplying the transfer function by itself several times, and removing intermediate transfer functions.

Parameters:
  • dlnz_factor (int) – The factor to increase dlnz by.
  • delete_tfs (bool) – If true, only retains transfer functions in tflist that have an index that is a multiple of dlnz_factor.
  • coarsen_type ({'prop', 'dep'}) – The type of coarsening. Use ‘prop’ to coarsen by taking powers of the transfer function. Use ‘dep’ for deposition transfer functions, where coarsening is done by taking self * sum_i prop_tf**i.
  • prop_tflist (TransferFuncList) – The transfer function for propagation, if the transfer function represents deposition.
dlnz
eng¶
grid_vals¶
in_eng
rs
tflist
tftype
transpose()¶

Transposes the list of transfer functions.

This takes a TransferFuncList made of TransFuncAtEnergy into a list a TransferFuncList made of TransFuncAtRedshift and vice-versa.

class darkhistory.spec.transferfunclist.TransferFuncInterp(tflistarrs, rs_nodes=None, log_interp=False)¶

Bases: object

Interpolation function over list of TransferFuncList objects.

Parameters:
  • tflist_arr (list of TransferFuncList) – TransferFuncList objects to interpolate over. Should be indexed by xH, (redshift regime) or (redshift regime, xH, xHe)
  • x_arr (None or ndarray) – Array of xH or (xH, xHe) values corresponding to tflist_arr.
  • rs_nodes (ndarray) – List of redshifts to transition between redshift regimes.
  • log_interp (bool, optional) – If True, performs an interpolation over log of the grid values.
rs¶

Redshift abscissa of the transfer functions.

Type:list of ndarray
in_eng¶

Injection energy abscissa of the transfer functions.

Type:list of ndarray
eng¶

Energy abscissa of the spectrum.

Type:list of ndarray
dlnz¶

The d ln(1+z) step for the transfer functions.

Type:list of float
spec_type¶

The type of spectra stored in the transfer functions.

Type:tuple of {‘N’, ‘dNdE’}
rs_nodes¶

List of redshifts to transition between redshift regimes.

Type:ndarray
grid_vals¶

The grid values in each redshift regime.

Type:tuple of ndarray
x¶

Array of xH or (xH, xHe) in each redshift regime.

Type:tuple of ndarray
interp_func¶

An interpolation function over xH (optionally xHe) and rs.

Type:function
